lines.content: Talko is a simple task management application that allows users to create and manage tasks via command-line input. This guide will help you understand how to use Talko effectively.
Displays all tasks in the task list.
Adds a new todo task with the given description.
Adds a new task with a deadline.
event <description> /from <start time in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format> /to <end time in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format>
Adds a new event with a start and end time.
Marks the specified task as completed.
Marks the specified task as not completed.
Removes the specified task from the list.
Searches for tasks that contain the given keyword.
Lists all the commands out with brief description.
- If a command is not recognized, Talko will notify you with an error message.
- If required arguments are missing in a command, Talko will prompt you with the correct format.
- Task indices must be valid numbers corresponding to tasks in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T] [✓] Read a book
Enjoy using Talko to manage your tasks efficiently!
* The main class for the Talko application.
* This class initializes the necessary components and manages the program flow.
* Starts the main loop of the Talko application.
* Continuously takes user input and processes commands until an exit command is received.
* The entry point of the Talko application.
* Handles user commands and performs appropriate actions based on input.
* A CommandHandler object processes various commands related to task management.
* Processes user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param input The command input from the user.
* @throws TalkoException If an invalid command is given or an error occurs during execution.
public void handleCommand(String input) throws TalkoException {
if (argument.trim().isEmpty()) throw new TalkoException("Description cannot be empty! Please enter a description of your task!");
if (deadlineDetails.length < 2) throw new TalkoException("Oops Invalid format :( Try rewriting it to this format: deadline <description> /by <yyyy-mm-dd hhmm>");
if (eventDetails.length < 3) throw new TalkoException("Oops Invalid format :( Try rewriting it to this format: event <description> /from <yyyy-mm-dd hhmm> /to <yyyy-mm-dd hhmm>");
throw new TalkoException("Command not recognized. Please try entering <help> for more information.");
* Exception class for handling errors specific to the Talko application.
* A TalkoException is thrown when an invalid command is encountered
* or when an error occurs during command execution.
* Manages a list of tasks, allowing addition, removal, modification, and retrieval of tasks.
* Adds a new task to the list and saves it to storage.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Displays all tasks currently stored in the list.
* If no tasks exist, it notifies the user.
* Marks a task based on its index and isDone value.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as completed.
* @param isDone The true sets task to done and false sets task to not done.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the index is out of bounds.
public void markTask(int index, boolean isDone) throws TalkoException {
throw new TalkoException("Please enter a valid task number!");
* Removes a task from the task list and saves the updated list to storage.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task number is invalid.
public void removeTask(int index) throws TalkoException {
throw new TalkoException("Please enter a valid task number!");
* Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for within task descriptions.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the keyword is empty.
public void findTasks(String keyword) throws TalkoException {
throw new TalkoException("Please provide a keyword to search.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
throw new TalkoException("No tasks found with the keyword: " + keyword);
* Displays the list of available commands and their descriptions.
System.out.println("    - Displays all tasks in your task list.");
System.out.println("    - Adds a new to-do task.");
System.out.println("    - Adds a new task with a deadline.");
System.out.println("    - Format of the due date is yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (in 24 hr clock)");
System.out.println("    - Adds a new task as an event");
System.out.println("    - Format of the from and to times is yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (in 24 hr clock)");
System.out.println("    - Marks the specified task as done.");
System.out.println("    - Marks the specified task as not done.");
System.out.println("    - Removes the specified task from the list.");
System.out.println("    - Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword.");
System.out.println("    - Shows a list of available commands.");
* Handles reading from and writing to a file that stores task data.
* Loads tasks from the file into an ArrayList.
* If the file does not exist, an empty list is returned.
System.out.println("File not found. Starting with an empty task list.");
* Saves the given list of tasks to a file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.

* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* A Deadline object stores a task description and a due date/time.
this.by = parseDateTime(by); // Parse date string to LocalDateTime
* Parses a date-time string into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param by The date-time string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
* @return A LocalDateTime object representing the parsed date and time.
* Formats a LocalDateTime object into a human-readable string.
* @return A string representing the formatted date and time.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, hh:mm a");
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A string containing the task type, status, description, and formatted deadline.
* Converts the deadline task into a file-friendly format.
* @return A string representation of the deadline task for storage.
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* An Event task has a description, a start time, and an end time.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* @param time The date-time string in "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" format.
* Formats a LocalDateTime object into a user-friendly string.
* @param dateTime The LocalDateTime object to format.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, hh:mm a");
* Returns the formatted string representation of the event task.
* @return A string representation of the event task including its type, status, description, and time range.
* Converts the event object into a standardized file format for storage.
* @return A formatted string representation of the event task for file storage.
* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.
* Marks the task as done or not done.
* @param isDone True if the task is completed, false otherwise.
System.out.println(isDone ? "Marked as Done!" : "Marked as Not Done!");
* Returns a status icon representing task completion.
* "X" indicates the task is completed, while a space " " indicates it is not.
* @return A string representing the task's status.
* Gets the formatted task description, including its status icon.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Converts the task into a file-friendly format for storage.
* @return A string representing the task in a storable format.
* Represents a Todo task, which is a simple task without additional details.
* Retrieves the formatted description of the Todo task.
* @return A string representing the Todo task with its status.
* Converts the Todo task into a standardized file format for storage.
* @return A string representing the Todo task in a storable format.
* Handles user interaction, including displaying messages and reading input.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("How can I help you today?");

* @return The user input as a string.
